topic.title: How To's with the Network Service HP Cloud OS Compute Service

body.p: The following lists of tasks can be performed by a user or administrator use through the appropraite dashboard or API.

section.title: Tasks performed by users
section.p: The following Compute service tasks are usually performed by someone with the user role.

required-cleanup.title: Working with a virtual machine
required-cleanup.p: When working with the compute service, you can perform a number of tasks with your virtual machines (VM), including creating and deleting VMs, starting and stopping a VM, and attaching the VM to a storage volume.

required-cleanup.title: Create a VM
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to create a new virtual machine.

required-cleanup.title: Create a VM which boots from a Volume
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to create a bootable virtual machine associated with a bootable volume.

required-cleanup.title: Reboot a VM
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to reboot a virtual machine, as needed

required-cleanup.title: Rebuild a VM
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to rebuild a virtual machine as needed.

required-cleanup.title: Start / Stop a VM
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to start and stop a virtual machine.

required-cleanup.title: Create / Delete a snapshot of a VM
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to create a snapshot of a virtual machine that you can use to create other VMs

required-cleanup.title: Rescue / Unrescue a VM
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to resuce a VM.

required-cleanup.title: Delete a VM
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to delete a virtual machine that is no longer needed.

required-cleanup.title: Attach / Detach a Volume to/from a VM
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to attach or detach a storage volume to a virtual machine.

required-cleanup.title: Get console log of a VM
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to display a log of virtual machine activity.

required-cleanup.title: Get VNC console connection to a VM
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to remotely connect to a virtual machine using a VNC (Virtual Network Computing) console.

required-cleanup.title: Associate / disassociated Floating IP address
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to allocate and associate floating IP addresses for a virtual machine.

required-cleanup.title: Working with security groups
required-cleanup.p: When working with the compute service, you can perform a number of tasks with the security groups in your project.

required-cleanup.title: Create / upload / delete a key pair
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to create a key pair, generate a new key pair using an existing pubkic key, and delete a key pair.

section.title: Tasks performed by an Administrator
section.p: The following Compute service tasks are usually performed by someone with the user role.

required-cleanup.title: Create / modify / delete a Flavor
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to create, delete, and modify the virtual machine flavors in a project. A flavor defines the hardware configuration (disk space and memory capacity).

required-cleanup.title: Modify the quota of a project
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to change the maximum limits on the number of objects (VMs, networks, and so on).

required-cleanup.title: Create / modify / delete Availability zone
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to manage availability zones (AZ) by creating and deleting AZs and modifying existing AZs.

required-cleanup.title: Enable / Disable a service
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to enable or disable services available in a project.

required-cleanup.title: Lock / Unlock a VM
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to lock or unlock a virtual machine, as needed.

required-cleanup.title: Pause / Unpause a VM
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to pause and un-pause a virtual machine.
The pause command stores the state of the VM in RAM. A paused instance continues to run in a frozen state.

required-cleanup.title: Suspend / Resume a VM
required-cleanup.p: Use the compute service to suspend and un-suspend a virtual machine.

When you suspend an instance, its VM state is stored on disk, all memory is written to disk, and the virtual machine is stopped. Suspending an instance is similar to placing a device in hibernation; memory and vCPUs become available.
